conbody.p: The Editor area is the largest window in the interface where you create or modify models. The Editor area provides a flexible free-form layout that does not restrict how you construct your diagram, although a general left-to-right flow of elements is recommended. You can open more than one file at a time in the Editor area. The names of the opened files are shown as tabs across the top of the Editor area, which lets you easily switch between open files. Only one file, however, can be active (displayed or edited) at a time in the Editor area.

Editor View for Design Studio models provide a tab Source at the bottom of the Editor View. It leads you to the Data Specific Language (DSL) editor of the same model. This other way of editing model is very useful when you have massive changes to make or Find/Replace action to apply. It comes with validation rules and content assist (Ctrl + space) to help you amending the model in accordance with the DSL rules. You can switch from graphical to DSL editor at any time.
Tip To enlarge the Editor area to view or edit a large diagram, you can use the divider bars to resize the area.
The Editor area contains the following icons:

strow.stentry: Indicates an error in the properties of an element. If the properties of an element are incorrect or incomplete, this red x-shaped icon is displayed in the model near the element. Detailed text information about the error is also available in the Problems tab of the Properties view pane. The icon disappears when the required information is completed.
